summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons clinical encounter and cosign document detailing the medical emergency and resuscitation efforts for inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. It records the response to a 'body alarm' at 6:35 AM, finding Epstein unresponsive in his cell with signs of neck trauma, and details the extensive CPR and life support measures performed before he was transported to a local ER.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019, triggering a full resuscitation effort.

connections.description: RN was the healthcare provider who documented and participated in the emergency medical response for inmate Epstein.
MD cosigned the medical documentation related to Epstein's cardiac arrest and resuscitation.
MD provided a cosignature for the clinical documentation created by the RN, indicating supervisory or collaborative review.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: At approximately 6:35 AM, a 'body alarm' was triggered for a medical emergency. Jeffrey Epstein was found on the floor of his cell in the Special Housing Unit, unresponsive, cold, with bruising around the neck, and CPR already in progress by correctional officers.

events.title: Extended Resuscitation Attempt
events.description: From 6:35 AM onward, extensive life-saving measures were performed including continuous CPR, placement of an endotracheal tube by paramedics, administration of epinephrine and sodium bicarbonate, and use of a cardiac monitor which showed asystole (no heart rhythm).

events.title: Transport to Emergency Room
events.description: After approximately 40 minutes of resuscitation efforts in the prison's Health Services Unit, Epstein was transported to a local emergency room with CPR still in progress.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM - likely New York Metropolitan)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:35 AM.
The clinical note documents 'circumferential bruising around the neck' and 'posterior mottling' upon initial assessment of Epstein.
Despite extensive resuscitation efforts including CPR, intubation, and cardiac medications, Epstein remained in asystole (cardiac standstill) and was transported to an outside hospital.
The document is a formal Bureau of Prisons medical record, cosigned by a physician, detailing the timeline and medical interventions of the event.
